data.title: Where was Grey's Anatomy filmed?
data.meta_description: Meredith Grey fans will love seeing where some of their favorite scenes were shot. Just pack this movie locations guide in your luggage and youâre off to LA.
data.text:
Where was Grey's Anatomy filmed?

2005

City Locations

Los Angeles, California

Location Types

American, Contemporary, ââHospitals/Medical

Location Styles

Contemporary Modern

About Grey's Anatomy

Based in the fictional Seattle Grace Hospital, Greyâs Anatomy follows the escapades and daily lives of a series of doctors as they face challenging situations, love troubles and life and death scenarios.

Run by television juggernaut, Shonda Rhimes, Greyâs Anatomy is one of the longest running TV shows in history and fans simply cannot get enough. Famously, it launched the careers of its stars into the stratosphere, making household names of actors such as Ellen Pompeo, Sandra Oh, and Patrick Dempsey among others.

Although the show has been going since 2005, somehow the showrunners and writers manage to find ways to keep the seasons fresh and interesting, with a mix of old and new faces, and plenty of guest stars over the years.

The key plots surround Meredith Grey (Ellen Pompeo) who starts off as a recently qualified doctor, looking to find a specialism and make a good impression. Add in the complications of falling in love with your boss, having a legendary mother who is huge in the world of medicine, and all the usual nonsense of navigating your twenties and thirties, and it makes for an entertaining and emotional ride.

One of the iconic things that Greyâs Anatomy is known for is its amazing and bang-on soundtrack. The production team somehow manages to match the perfect song to the moment, most famously using The Frayâs How to Save a Life. Itâs a little on the nose, but the fans definitely appreciated it!

Grey's Anatomy Locations

Although Greyâs Anatomy is almost entirely set in Seattle, Washington, very little of the series is actually shot there. In the earlier seasons, there were more filming locations in Seattle, however as the show went on, more and more sets were built on the sound stages in Los Angeles.

In fact, many prominent sets are all based in LA, pretending to be Seattle. Every single interior shot of Seattle Grace (later Grace Sloan Memorial), was in a set that was created in the studios in LA. They couldnât take over a real hospital after all, could they?

The only hospital related shot in the show thatâs not based in these studios is the exterior entrance of the hospital, which is the Veterans Hospital in the North Hills area of LA.

Of course, the Greyâs Anatomy production team does head up to Seattle each season to shoot cityscape scenes as well as any footage that includes the hospitalâs helipad. After all, LA has a distinct skyline that you definitely wouldnât be able to pass off as Seattle!

All in all, the production team of Greyâs Anatomy does a pretty amazing job of making Los Angeles look and feel like Seattle, not just on a one-off basis, but consistently for almost 20 years! Incredible.

If thereâs one phrase that fans the world over recognize as Greyâs Anatomy, itâs the infamous âIâm your personâ. Itâs said numerous times between Meredith (Ellen Pompeo) and Cristina (Sandra Oh) as a mark of their friendship, but the first time is in the season two opener at Joeâs Bar.

Joeâs is the place where our doctors let loose after a stressful day at work, so itâs used a lot during the show.

In the earlier seasons of the show, Joeâs Bar was actually McMurphyâs Restaurant and Tavern in Pasadena, CA. However, when it closed down, rather than switch up the location, the Greyâs Anatomy production team built a direct replica of Joeâs at the studios. Pretty amazing, right?

Although McMurphyâs has closed, you can still find eateries and bars around the site at 72 North Fair Oaks Avenue. You can get there pretty easily via the Metro L Line (Gold) or using a whole host of different bus lines that pass close by.

Okay, this is about to get emotional. Donât say we didnât warn you. In an episode and a scene in season 8 that is stuck in the mind of every person thatâs ever watched it, we see a lot of our favorite characters either die, get injured, and/or suffer some major trauma.

Thatâs right, itâs the plane crash episode. Going down in Greyâs Anatomy lore as one of the best episodes of the entire show, this is the scene where we see little Lexie Grey (Chyler Leigh) die, holding hands with Mark Sloane (Eric Dane), the unlikely boyfriend.

Mark doesnât want to admit whatâs actually happening, he thinks he can help get her free, help her survive, but her medical knowledge tells her that itâs not going to end well for her. In the end, she stops him spiraling, saying:

âMark, Iâm dyingâ. Wow.

This iconic Greyâs Anatomy scene was filmed at Big Bear Lake in California, which is home to a super popular ski and mountain biking resort. So, if you like your holidays on the active side and want to check out a major Greyâs Anatomy filming location at the same time, this is the place for you!

As itâs out in the mountains, unfortunately, public transport is few and far between, so your best bet is loading up your car and making it a road trip.

So, Meredithâs house, or the intern house as itâs sometimes referred to, is one of the most used filming locations after the hospital sets. Itâs where our main characters decompress, with pretty much the whole gang living there at one point or another.

As itâs a kind of boarding house for new and old doctors, sometimes there can be a personality clash. This is pretty apparent when both Lexie and Alex (Justin Chambers) are living there, with very different ways of handling things.

After Alex gets annoyed with Lexie at work, he refuses to get her a beer at home when she asks politely. This soon snowballs into a rant for Lexie about how Alex needs to sort his issues and not take things out on her. This culminates in her shouting:

"I am a nice person!". Really, she is.

Meredithâs house or the intern house, is one of the few real-life filming locations that are in Seattle. You can find it at 303 Comstock Street, in Queen Anne, Seattle.

If youâre traveling by bus, the house is a couple of blocks away from both the number 2 and number 29 lines.

Why is it that Cristina gets some of the best, most iconic lines in the entire show? We love you, Sandra Oh!

In season 3, when Cristina gets offered a dream position in Switzerland and following a pretty terrible personal time, she decides to leave Seattle and Meredith with it. In their emotional goodbye scene, she reminds her that her career and dreams are just as important as her husband, Derekâs (Patrick Dempsey).

âHe's very dreamy, but he is not the sun, you are,â Cristina said.

This, like many of the key scenes in Greyâs Anatomy, took place within Seattle Grace Hospital. As there are plenty of similar rooms and operating theatres that need to be used season after season, the production team opted to use Los Feliz's Prospect Studios in LA.

This way, the team could build all the sets and have them identical, time and time again, without having to take over a real hospital and design the sets around what's already there. Smart, right?

The ââLoz Feliz Prospect Studios are obviously still a working studio lot, so itâs not always open for visitors, but if you want to do a bit of star-spotting, you can always hang around the gates. There are a lot of great eateries and coffee shops to set up shop in.

The 182 bus stops right outside the gate, so if youâre looking to catch a glimpse of your Greyâs Anatomy favorites, you can do just that.

Okay, so this show has no shortage of tumultuous relationships and general love-based drama, but when it came to fiery, complex relationships, Cristina and Owen (Kevin McKidd) probably took the top spot.

In this massively emotionally charged scene from season 7, Cristina comes home to explain that sheâs booked an appointment to have her pregnancy terminated, something that Owen definitely didnât want to hear.

She explains this and before he can say anything she says, âI cannot talk about it anymore, I need to lie down, I feel like crapâ.

Unfortunately, this is not the kind of thing you can say and walk out on. It turns into a huge fight and ultimately itâs the beginning of the end for this major Greyâs Anatomy couple.

Cristina and Owenâs firehouse is the thing of interior design dreams for many fans, and you can find the closed down Fire Station in the Skid Row area of Los Angeles. Specifically, they lived in Fire Station 23, which can be found at 225 E. 5th Street.

If youâre traveling by bus the 18, 53, 62 and 720 lines all pass super close to the Fire Station.

All in all, thereâs a reason why Greyâs Anatomy has been going for as long as it has, and has been so successful. Not only for its lead actors but as a springboard for many members of the crew and showrunner, Shonda Rhimes.

Whether weâll still find ourselves treading the halls of Grace Sloan memorial in another 15 years or so, only time will tell, but weâll definitely be along for the ride.
